conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, multiple wall faces visible, and interior volume exposed by removing the roof/ceiling.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and floor/wall separation; cutaway is clean and interior is clearly visible with minimal distortion.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (two bedrooms, central wet/core rooms, open living/dining/kitchen). Some proportional differences and several door/window placements from the 2D plan are simplified/omitted in the 3D render.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present and placed in the expected rooms (beds, sofa, dining, kitchen, bath fixtures, desk). Scale/orientation generally reasonable with minor simplification.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors/furniture with clean presentation; lighting supports legibility. Minor clarity loss due to missing/unclear openings (windows/doors).

detected_errors.description: Doors and especially windows/openings are simplified or missing compared to the 2D plan; several swing-door locations are not explicitly modeled as doors.
Minor-to-moderate proportional/layout drift in a few partitions and room dimensions (some wall runs/room widths do not perfectly match the 2D plan).

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and furnishings, but with noticeable simplification/mismatch of doors/windows and some room proportion drift.
